meanings.definition: To establish or fix deeply or firmly
meanings.sent1: The roots of the tree were engrafted into the soil, ensuring its stability.
meanings.sent2: She engrafted her love for music in her children from a young age.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog engrafted in my mind and made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was engrafted in his soul, making him unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her laughter engrafted in his heart, never to be forgotten.

meanings.definition: To incorporate or implant something into something else
meanings.sent1: The chef engrafted the secret ingredient into the recipe, enhancing its flavor.
meanings.sent2: He engrafted the new technology seamlessly into the existing system.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying car engrafted into the conversation, sparking excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her words engrafted hope into his weary heart, renewing his spirit.
meanings.sent5: The artist engrafted his emotions into the painting, creating a masterpiece.
